result.execSummary:
The defendant Esmeralda Rocha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 62 days credit.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with witnesses: Nick T. or his child N.L.T. (11-22-1998), Edward K., Duron B., Maurice C., Donna P., Miguel S. or their residences.
No contact with victims:  John B., Damien J. or his children C.J. (11-14-2005) and L.J. (10-23-2008) and any other member of their family or their residences.
No contact with any gang members or known drug users.
Defendant may have contact with her sister Dora R., with specific condition of not to discuss the cases pending against Zakaria A. (11CF174) and Alonso C. (14CF154) with anyone other than her attorney.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay appropriate surcharges.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Attend at least 2 self help meetings per week.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED.
To be used at Agent's discretion and Agent to determine with or without non working hours.

Case called for the defendant's petition for expunction.

State objects and places reasons on the record.

For reasons stated on the record, the court denies the petition for expunction.
Review hearing on May 27, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Esmeralda Rocha in court, in custody, with attorney Eric D Lowenberg.   Bryan C Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
The State places pretrail offer on the record. 
Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1.  Counts 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in. 
The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED and STAYED SENTENCE of: 

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 62 days)
  -  1 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, or controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with:  Alonso G, Zakaria A., their resdidences or any of their family members;
*No contact with Witnesses: Nick T, or his child, N.L.T (11/22/98), Edward K., Duron B., Maurice C., Donna P., Miguel S. or thier residences.
*No contact with Victims: John B., Damien J. or his children C.J. (11/14/05) and L.J. (10/23/08), and any other member of thier family or their residences;
*No contact with any gang members or know drug users;
*Defendant may have contact with her sister Dora R., with specific condition of not to discuss the cases pending against Zakaria A. (11CF174) and Alonso C. (14CF154) with anyone other than her attorney.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done and pay appropriate surcharges. 
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
*Attend at least 2 self help meetings per week. 

COURT COSTS:  $268 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  60 DAYS - STAYED; to be used at agent's discretion.  Agent to determine with or without non working hours.  

IF REVOKED:  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

The court reserves the defendant's right to request expunction.

Jury trial - 12 person on May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 15, 2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program within 1 business day of being reased from custody including random urine screens.   Defendant to have no contact with Damian J., Alonso C., Miguel S., John B., and Zakaria A. and that includes any type of third party contact such as texting or email.

Defendant Esmeralda Rocha in court, in custody, with attorney Eric D. Lowenberg.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for motion to modify bail.  State is objecting to any bail modification and places their reasons on the record. Attorney Lowenberg is requesting cash bail be reduced for the defendant to post and enter into treatment. Further arguments are placed on the record by both parties. 
The court reduces the cash bail to $5000 and adds additional no contact provisions at the State's request.  
Speedy trial demand entered. 

  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:45 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
